intro: Caelestina ageratoides var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf blue mistflower, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens and wetland restoration projects.
